"Long-term support (LTS) until 2023". Use composr_patch.sh to apply patch (read the echo statements before running). CKEditor 5 is a non-Open Source license and removes a lot of features, so for now at least we will stay on CKEditor 4. CKEditor 5 does support CSP which is a definite advantage. Likely we will migrate when CKEditor has reached feature parity and we've confirmed we'll be provided a special permanent Open Source licence for it.

Heavily forked specifically for Composr. Different SugarCRM versions and forks may differ in APIs and we try and make them all work as possible. Making a unit test is not practical as there is no public test site.
The newer Horde-maintained version has a lot of dependencies, over-complex for a simple diff library. For what we've used we had to comment some assert calls for PHP 7.2 compatibility.

While this library is not maintained, it's still the best for us. There's https://github.com/dg/twitter-php which has much less functionality, and https://github.com/abraham/twitteroauth which is relatively bloated. If Twitter class stops working we'll likely either maintain it ourselves in a new repository, or switch to abraham/twitteroauth.
Library is not maintained, but there are some embedded jQuery libraries that needed updated for the newest jQuery - and that's now done.
